main

Class Scoreboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Scoreboard

  • public class Scoreboard
extends java.lang.Object
    Score board holds the players current scores and the max score among all the players.
    Author:
    Micah T. Moore

    • Field Detail

      • maxPoints

        private int maxPoints

      • playerScores

        private int[] playerScores

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scoreboard

        Scoreboard(int numPlayers)
        Constructs the score board based on the number of players. Initializes the max score to 0.
        Parameters:
        numPlayers - the number of players in the game

    • Method Detail

      • updateScores

        public int updateScores(int[] pScores)
        Updates this score board's player scores. Also updates the max score field of this score board.
        Parameters:
        pScores - integer array of current round scores to add to the running scores on the score board.
        Returns:
        the player number (index) of the player with the highest score.

      • printScores

        public void printScores()
        Displays the current score of all the players on this score board.

      • checkWin

        public int checkWin(int numPlayers)
        Checks this score board to see if a player satisfies the win conditions. To win a player must have more than 20 points, and be in the lead by at least 2 points.
        Parameters:
        numPlayers - number of players involved in the game.
        Returns:
        The index of the winning player. -1 if no player has won.

      • closestSecond

        public int closestSecond()
        Checks this score board to find how close second place is to the leader. This is intended to determine how much the leading player is winning by.
        Returns:
        The leader's score minus second place's score.

      • getMaxPoints

        public int getMaxPoints()

      • setMaxPoints

        public void setMaxPoints(int maxPoints)

      • getPlayerScores

        public int[] getPlayerScores()

      • setPlayerScores

        public void setPlayerScores(int[] playerScores)
